intro: Acronema edosmioides, commonly known as the narrow-leafed acronema, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia, including countries like Thailand and Malaysia. The plant is characterized by its slender, aromatic stems and small, compound leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow and are arranged in umbels, a common feature in the carrot family. Acronema edosmioides is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth.
